Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 12:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

This work is taking place in the Moses Spring Wood area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
We have identified a piece of equipment called a transformer that needs upgrading from a single phase to three phase. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future whilst ensuring our network can cope with the amount of electricity in the area. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off and upgrade the transformer. Whilst carrying out this work our contractors will also be replacing 4 electricity poles and 12 cables.
 During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. Completing this work will improve the reliability of your network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned outage as we appreciate your area has been impacted by unplanned power cuts. This work is taking place on Billinghurst Road. Two way traffic lights will be in place to allow our work to be carried out safely.

This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Flowers Bottom Lane.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 10:37 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers reconfigured the cabling on the underground network in the Darnley Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property who we will be in touch with directly. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Thanks for bearing with us over today.

Our specialist cable jointers have so far been unable to pinpoint the underground cabling fault, so they have instructed our digging gang to excavate our cabling. This will allow them to cut our cable, and using specialist equipment, test each side to help narrow down where the fault lies.

Our estimated time frame doesn't need to change currently, and we'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here on 08003163105 from any phone if you have any questions. Sent by Will at 09:49.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our relief team of engineers are beginning to arrive on site to locate the fault on our underground network and carry out repairs. At this stage we don't need to change the estimated time frame and I will continue to keep you updated with our engineers progress.

If you have a vulnerable person at home, please call us on 08003163105 and we'll see if we can provide any additional support. Sent at 08:06 by Will
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Will at 10:45 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers connected a generator to our network in the Horsham Lane area. We believe all power should now be restored and back to normal running.

If your power isn't back on or you are still experiencing any issues, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have advised that an existing generator currently on the network needs to be adjusted as well as the new on attached to the network. Due to this unexpected delay we have had to make another slight adjustment to our estimated time frame and we're now aiming to have the power back on between 11:00 and 12:00.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on. Sent at 09:52 by Will.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry if you're still having problems with your power this morning, our engineers have advised that whilst they continue to try to locate the issue on our overhead network, they will be using temporary generators to provide power.

We have these on site now and are sending specialist engineers to connect them for us. At this stage we're estimating to have the power back on between 10:00 and 11:00. I'll continue to keep you updated with their progress but in the mean time, if you have any questions or concerns, don't hesitate to call us free on 105. Sent by Will at 08:27.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 20:44 - We can now confirm that all power in the Coolhurst Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers are on site investigating in the Coolhurst Road area and have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 22:00 and 23:00 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. We will let you know when we hear more from site. Sent by Lisa at 20:13.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 18:28 - We're sorry your power has gone off again. We are sending our engineers back to the Coolhurst Road area to investigate why.

Currently, our time frame for power to be restored is between 22:00 and 23:00, but once our staff arrive on site and assess the situation, this time may change. As there have been other power cuts recently it's difficult to know what repairs will be needed to restore your power safely, so time frames we provide throughout have to be estimated.

The results of our engineer's tests on our network will let us know if our estimate needs to be adjusted, so we'll update you as soon as they have arrived on site and investigated.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Donny at 22:17 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Aberdeen Park area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this evening. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Donny at 21:57.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Aberdeen Park area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Kevin at 08:21.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Burry Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 12:00 and 13:00 this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Kevin at 07:35.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 07:10 - Our staff are on the way to the Burry Road area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 12:00 and 13:00. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

MainMessage: We are currently experiencing problems with the electricity supply in your area.  We are arranging to have engineers investigate the fault.  We are sorry we can't give you a time for the restoration of supply at present. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 08:14. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: A fault has occurred on a piece of our electrical equipment which controls the power to your home.
PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Fuse Replacement/Linking affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 02-FEB-2026 12:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.
